result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laurie L. Wildcat

defendant.name: Wildcat, Laurie L.
defendant.address: 311 Miigiizii Circle, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Laurie L. Wildcat in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Laurie L. Wildcat.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights complied with. A number of victims are appearing via zoom audio and are able to hear and see the court. State speaks to the status of the case. Defense speaks. Waiting for final reports to come from law enforcement. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

3:24 PM Defendant Laurie L. Wildcat in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Laurie L. Wildcat.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Victims EA, JR, R and SR attended via Zoom appearance.  States speaks to being in the discovery phase at this time.  Joint request to adjournment for 30 days out. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

No contact with B.K.(1989), No contact with SR (1980), No contact with  JR (1984) to reside with Jane Beeler or James Thompson at 2162 Wildcat Circle, Lac du Flambeau.  During curfew hours Jane Beeler or James Thompson must be on the premise with defendant. Curfew of 9pm to 6 am.  Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.  Not to operate a motor vehicle.

1:59 PM Defendant Laurie L. Wildcat appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for Laurie L. Wildcat.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim Witness Coordinator Glenna Davis in court. Victim SR appeared via zoom technology. Bond modified.
No contact with B.K.(1989), No contact with SR (1980), No contact with  JR (1984) to reside with Jane Beeler or James Thompson at 2162 Wildcat Circle, Lac du Flambeau.  During curfew hours Jane Beeler or James Thompson must be on the premise with defendant. Curfew of 9pm to 6 am.  Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.  Not to operate a motor vehicle.

1:49 PM Defendant Laurie L. Wildcat in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Laurie L. Wildcat.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls Detective Cody Remick, sworn in and testifies. Defense stipulates to identification. Attorney Hayes requests bind over. Attorney Snyder rejects bind over. Court find probable cause to bind over. NG plea to sole count.  Information to be e-filed by state. Court reviews Attorney Snyder's motion to reduce bond. Court denies motion to modify bond. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

11:32 AM Defendant Laurie L. Wildcat appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for Laurie L. Wildcat. Family of victim appears by zoom.  Attorney Snyder has received complaint this morning.  Attorney Snyder reads the charges to the defendant on the record.  Court reads charges.  Motion to modify bond.  Court advises defense to file a written bond modification motion.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

No contact with B.K.(1989), Curfew of 9pm to 6 am 24/7 and to be on the premises of 311 Miigiizii Cir during curfew hours , Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.  
22-007311

1:35 PM Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Bednar appears specially.  Attorney Snyder will be representing defendant in the matter.  DA Karl Hayes appears for the State of Wisconsin.  No complaint filed yet. Victim witness appears by video.  DA Hayes speaks to the incident that occurred that resulted in the defendant's arrest. Court makes finding of probable cause for purposes of bond hearing and setting bond.   Bond set at $5,000 Cash with conditions: No contact with B.K.(1989), Curfew of 9pm to 6 am 24/7 and to be on the premises of 311 Miigiizii Cir during curfew hours , Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.  Bond form. Court will address curfew if needed for reasons of defendant securing employment.  Defense to file bond motion if necessary.
Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
